alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 15 at 3:07PM MDT until September 15 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES... At 307 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding in Capitol Gorge. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks, streams, normally dry washes, slot canyons and slick rock areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park as well as Capitol Gorge, Pleasant Creek, and Burro Wash. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
